alert.note: Alert for Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 24 at 12:04AM CDT until July 24 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR CENTRAL SEVIER COUNTY... At 104 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms that produced heavy rain across the warned area have shifted to the west southwest during the past hour. Lighter rains were falling across the warned area but runoff is expected to continue. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain is estimated to have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area during the next hour. Flash flooding is still possible as runoff continues. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rainfall from slow moving thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sevierville, Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Pittman Center, Harrisburg, Elkmont, Wears Valley, Great Smoky Mountains National Park, Roundtop Mountain State Park and Fairgarden. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
